name: pellucidly

in a way that is very clear and easy to understand: pellucidly clear His position is pellucidly clear. This is surely one of the most pellucidly clear expressions of neo-classical architecture.
More examplesFewer examplesWe found the details less than pellucidly clear.It is pellucidly clear that the founders of Australia saw no role for their High Court in relation to this type of constitutional amendment.The book is a beautifully printed and bound volume, and its typography and illustrations are pellucidly achieved.
